description.narrative: Girls and boys have increased permanence in the basic education system, based on intersectoral policies addressing diversity, including contextualized education., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Evaluation And Research, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021 boys and girls have increased access to quality and responsive health, education and social protection programmes, and actively participate in the design, implementation and monitoring of these services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls and boys have increased permanence in the basic education system, based on intersectoral policies addressing diversity, including contextualized education.

description.narrative: In order to guarantee the permanence of boys and girls in schools and prevent drop-out, UNICEF provided capacity building to municipal and state education public policy managers on reducing age-grade distortion. UNICEF promoted equitable and inclusive education practices across more than 10 states and 1,500 municipalities in Brazil. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020
